item.title: Business elite meet in shadow of report: 62 own same wealth as half the planet
item.description:
Business elite meet in shadow of report: 62 own same wealth as half the planet

DAVOS, Switzerland -- The world's political and business elite are being urged to do more than pay lip service to growing inequalities around the world as they head off for this week's World Economic Forum in the Swiss ski resort of Davos.

item.title: Key things to know about Suncor's takeover deal
item.description:
Key things to know about Suncor's takeover deal

CALGARY -- Suncor Energy has reached a friendly takeover deal with Canadian Oil Sands after bumping up its all share offer by 12 per cent. The company now is offering 0.28 of a Suncor (TSX:SU) share for each COS (TSX:COS) share, resulting in a $6.6-billion friendly deal between the two Calgary-based oilsands companies.

item.title: Calgary teen paralyzed in tobogganing accident
item.description:
Calgary teen paralyzed in tobogganing accident

The family of a Calgary teenager who was paralyzed from the waist down in a tobogganing accident is sharing their story in hopes of preventing a similar tragedy. Alex was tobogganing with friends on Dec. 21, his fifteenth birthday, when he hit a patch of ice and crashed head-first into a pole.

item.title: Player traded, sent to minors after being voted NHL all-star captain
item.description:
Player traded, sent to minors after being voted NHL all-star captain

A little-known left-winger who major-league hockey fans recently voted as team captain for the upcoming All-Star game has been sent to the minors in Canada, a move that may disqualify him from the upcoming NHL match. John Scott, 33, has scored just 11 points in eight seasons.

item.title: The importance of user reviews for local SEO
item.description:
The importance of user reviews for local SEO

They're also vital for local businesses, whether or not they sell online, thanks to their sheer prominence in local search results. Just look at this mobile search for restaurants in Chicago. The best organic listings are taken by the restaurants with good reviews: After this the next organic listings are mainly from review sites - Yelp, TripAdvisor, Time Out, Zagat, and so on.

item.title: Five of the most interesting SEM news stories of the week
item.description:
Five of the most interesting SEM news stories of the week

Welcome to our weekly round-up of all the latest news and research from around the world of search marketing and beyond. This week: Pandas, Periscopes and Paid search. As our own Chris Lake reported this week, there has been a new roll-out of Panda, and "it's a biggie."

item.title: YouTube Ads Leaderboard: December 2015
item.description:
YouTube Ads Leaderboard: December 2015

This month's Ads Leaderboard shows the most popular videos that people chose in December. In this edition, "Clash of Clans 360: Experience a Virtual Reality Raid" takes the top spot.

item.title: Muting the Global Dialogue in Davos
item.description:
Muting the Global Dialogue in Davos

The invitation was sent. And then, two weeks later, revoked. The World Economic Forum, which on Wednesday begins its annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland, brings together political and business leaders to discuss the world's most pressing problems. In years past, Vladimir V. Putin has attended. So has Bill Gates.

item.title: Why Consumer Intent Is More Powerful Than Demographics
item.description:
Why Consumer Intent Is More Powerful Than Demographics

Marketers who rely only on demographics to reach consumers risk missing more than 70% of potential mobile shoppers. Why? Because demographics rarely tell the whole story. Understanding consumer intent is much more powerful. Lisa Gevelber, Google's VP of marketing, shares how starting with intent can help you reach more of the right people than demographics alone.

item.title: Cameron says migrants must learn English
item.description:
Cameron says migrants must learn English

LONDON - Prime Minister David Cameron on Monday attacked what he called "passive tolerance" of some people in Britain's Muslim communities who support segregation and discrimination against women, and said his government would make it harder for migrants to remain in the country if they did not learn English.
